data.title: Always great
data.text: Always excellent bread and baked goods. Not cheap but never disappoints. Stopped by to pick up a housewarming gift for neighbors.

data.title: Boxed Lunch - Pass in the Future
data.text: We ordered Great Harvest box lunches for a conference recently.  For almost $10/box, I was very disappointed with the purchase.  The box was really about a $7 value; $8 tops. This is a cold sandwich and chips we're talking about!   We'll be choosing another business in the future to get better food at a better value.

data.title: Good place with a very friendly staff
data.text:
Been a few months, but I had to write a few words.  First, the staff has always been amazing, unless there is a line, then they get hectic.  I like the samples, they give you a feel of what is available, and is just plain a nice thing they do.

Have not had a sandwich at this one, but we use to eat at the one that closed and if this place is the same, they do a wonderful job.

Bread, a bit high priced, but very good.  The bad is, when I do get in it is usually after 15:00, and the stocks are well picked over.  Early morning last time I just wanted a snack and bought some Mazurka Bars, very good, even the wife liked them. 

If they were not a bit out of the way for me, I would try to patronize them more.

data.title: Feels Like a Small Town Bread Shop
data.text: This Great Harvest Bread Co. makes some excellent sandwiches with bread made from basic high quality ingredients. We usually get sandwiches here made with whole wheat, harvest Blend or Dakota whole wheat and all have been good choices.  They only serve sandwiches until 3:00 pm.  They also sell about 10 different types of breads by the loaf, including a variety of desert style breads.  This store has a great feel, like a small town bread shop.

data.title: A great place to get delicious breads and sandwiches and more
data.text: It is a wonderful little bread store.  The bread is freshly made daily many different varieties and it is delicious.  It is a great place to get food gifts for friend family and holiday.  The sandwiches are very tasty too the staff is helpful and friendly its a warm and happy atmosphere give it a try!

data.title: Good Homemade Bread
data.text: This is a great lunch place.  They have fantastic bread!  At lunch they serve sandwiches and soup also. Try their cinnamon bread, its yummy!

data.title: Good Baked Items
data.text: I love their muffins but you have to get there early or they sell out. I once commented that maybe they should make more if they are selling out so early and the girl looked at me like I was crazy. Seriously, I understand that you wouldn't want to waste them but if they are constantly selling out, maybe you should consider making more. Their breads and cookies are also very good and really taste like homemade.

data.title: mmmm smells so good!
data.text: The bread was awesome.  I thought the customer service was lacking though.  They need some training on etiquette.

data.title: The best Breads!
data.text: Great Harvest has a great variety of made fresh daily breads and goodies. Their sandwiches are delicious. The folks who work their are friendly and helpful. Don't miss out!

data.title: Poor Customer Service! Filthy Bread Racks!!
data.text:
Hey everyone please give notice to this write-up! Their products are only marginal at best compared to other Great Harvest locations!! Great Harvest are Franchises and are individually owned and operated! It is unfortunate that the quality of the bakery goods and cleanliness aren't checked by the Franchisor!! With as much disease that is so prevalent out in the world one can not be to careful anymore!! 

Here is something to think about!! How much would you appreciate it if the salesgirls told you were a interruption to their work??? The salesgirls  told an older couple that came in for a sandwich that they were closed! They advertise they close at 6PM and it was 5:45 when they told the couple they were closed!! They electrical open sign was lite when the couple came in.  I left mad and the girls knew it! As soon as left  they locked the door behind me!! As I was walking back to my car two other customers wanted in but were told they were closed!!!

I tried to tell Kathy one of the owners what had happened and she went ballistic on me!! She told me that the girls told her I asked them if they were religious in which I had, at first they seemed so nice but when I asked for another bread is when they told me I was interrupting then and they become rude!!

Well needless to say I will never go back and encouraged all my friends and family never to shop with them ever!! In fact my wife, daughter in law and several of her friends were out shopping for Christmas when they wanted to take in lunch. One of the suggestions were to go to Great Harvest for sandwiches but my wife told them my story and they all decided never to go there again!! They all agreed to shop other bakeries or other near by Great Harvest!!

data.title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip, Please
data.text: Fresh baked breads, muffins and treats for all! My favorite, obviously, is in the title; however, the cinnamon burst, wheat and sourdough breads are amazing. I'm also a big fan of their high-fiber muffins, naturally sweetened with apple sauce. My only gripe is that they're not open later hours. Sometimes, you just need a home-baked treat at 11:00 at night.

data.title: Great bread & sandwiches!
data.text: We love their chicken salad sandwich and request it be made on Cranberry Orange bread - so yummy!  And their sweet treats are scrumptious, especially their brownies!

data.title: I can't believe there aren't a million reviews on this place
data.text: We went in thinking it was just a bakery, but we saw some men on their lunch break eating outside. When we went in it smelled divine. The smell of warm fresh bread. We decided to get sandwiches, but the part we really enjoyed is that they will give you a full slice of any of the breads they baked that day to sample and a huge chunk of fresh butter to slather on the bread. We had our sandwiches (which were seriously delicious) on wheat bread, but we tried the cinnamon bread and butter. We ended up buying a whole loaf. Perfect for a snack or delicious made as toast in the morning with butter. YUM! And all the people working there were very very friendly and helpful. I wish we had one of these near where i live!!
